Class DecodeUpca

java.lang.Object
DecodeUpca
public class DecodeUpca extends Object
The DecodeUpca class provides methods to decode a binary representation of a UPCA code back into its product code.

  • Field Details

    • binaryRep

      private static String binaryRep
      The binary representation string to be decoded.

    • BINARY_NUMBERS_LEFT

      public static final String[] BINARY_NUMBERS_LEFT
      Array of binary representations for the left side of the UPCA code. Used by other methods to decode into UPCA code.

    • BINARY_NUMBERS_RIGHT

      public static final String[] BINARY_NUMBERS_RIGHT
      Array of binary representations for the right side of the UPCA code. Used by other methods to decode into UPCA code.

  • Constructor Details

    • DecodeUpca

      public DecodeUpca()
      Constructor for DecodeUpca class. Initializes the binaryRep to be an empty string.

  • Method Details

    • getBinaryRep

      public static String getBinaryRep()
      Getter for the currently set binaryRep.
      Returns:
      binaryRep as a string.

    • setBinaryRep

      public static void setBinaryRep(String binaryRep)
      Setter for setting the binary representation. This method checks for a valid binaryRep entry. binaryRep must be 95 digits long. If valid, binary representation is set to provided value. If not valid, binary representation is set to a default value of '10100011010011001001001101100010100011010111101010101000010001001000010100010010011101011100101'.
      Parameters:
      binaryRep - binary representation to be set

    • getCheckDigit

      public static String getCheckDigit(String binaryRep)
      Get the check digit from binary representation. This method takes the binary representation string as input, trims it to be only the right side after the center guard bar, decodes the same way as extractBinaryRepresentationLeft/Right, and trims the final string to only include the check digit in decimal form.
      Parameters:
      binaryRep - The binary representation to extract the check digit from.
      Returns:
      The check digit as a string.

    • getDigitLeft

      public static int getDigitLeft(String binaryDigits)
      Get the decimal value of binary digits on left side of binary string. This method takes a chunk of binary digits 7 digits long and runs through the indexes of BINARY_NUMBERS_LEFT. If the chunk matches with one of the indexes of BINARY_NUMBERS_LEFT, its index is returned which will be its decimal value. This method is utilized within extractBinaryRepresentationLeft/Right methods.
      Parameters:
      binaryDigits - The binary digits to convert.
      Returns:
      The index of where the chunk of binary digits was found within BINARY_NUMBERS. Or -1 if nothing is found.

    • getDigitRight

      public static int getDigitRight(String binaryDigits)
      Get the decimal value of binary digits on right side of binary string. This method takes a chunk of binary digits 7 digits long and runs through the indexes of BINARY_NUMBERS_RIGHT. If the chunk matches with one of the indexes of BINARY_NUMBERS_RIGHT, its index is returned which will be its decimal value. This method is utilized within extractBinaryRepresentationLeft/Right methods.
      Parameters:
      binaryDigits - The binary digits to convert.
      Returns:
      The index of where the chunk of binary digits was found within BINARY_NUMBERS_RIGHT. Or -1 if nothing is found.

    • decodeUpcaLeft

      public static String decodeUpcaLeft(String binaryRep)
      Decode the left side of a UPCA code from its binary representation. This method first trims binaryRep to include only from the end of the left guard bar up until the center guard. Uses extractBinaryRepresentationLeft method to decode.
      Parameters:
      binaryRep - String to be decoded.
      Returns:
      Decoded UPCA code string (left half)

    • decodeUpcaRight

      public static String decodeUpcaRight(String binaryRep)
      Decode the right side of a UPCA code from its binary representation. This method first trims binaryRep to include only from the end of the center guard bar up until the check digit in its binary form. Uses extractBinaryRepresentationRight method to decode.
      Parameters:
      binaryRep - String to be decoded.
      Returns:
      Decoded UPCA code string (right half)

    • getDecoded

      public static String getDecoded(String binaryRep)
      Gets the complete decoded UPCA code. Combines what is returned from decodeUpcaLeft/Right and returns as full decoded UPCA product code.
      Parameters:
      binaryRep - String to be decoded.
      Returns:
      Complete decoded UPCA code string.

    • extractBinaryRepresentationLeft

      public static String extractBinaryRepresentationLeft(String binaryRep)
      Extract binary digits and decode into a numeric UPCA product code representation from left side of binaryRep. This method takes a binary representation string as input. Extracts binary digits in chunks of 7 with the use of substring. Uses the getDigitLeft method to decode these chunks of binary digits. getDigitLeft returns the index of where the chunk was found within BINARY_NUMBERS_LEFT which happens to be the numeric value which is appended to the product code string. Iterates 6 times because left side contains 6 sets of 7 digit long binary representations. The finished UPCA product code string is returned. Uses StringBuilder to make the productCode string.
      Parameters:
      binaryRep - The binary representation to extract and decode.
      Returns:
      The decoded UPCA product code as a string.

    • extractBinaryRepresentationRight

      public static String extractBinaryRepresentationRight(String binaryRep)
      Extract binary digits and decode into a numeric UPCA product code representation from right side of binaryRep. This method takes a binary representation string as input. Extracts binary digits in chunks of 7 with the use of substring. Uses the getDigitRight method to decode these chunks of binary digits. getDigitRight returns the index of where the chunk was found within BINARY_NUMBERS_RIGHT which happens to be the numeric value which is appended to the product code string. Iterates only 5 times because right side only contains 5 sets of 7 digit long binary representations. The finished zipCode string is returned. Uses StringBuilder to make the product code string.
      Parameters:
      binaryRep - The binary representation to extract and decode.
      Returns:
      The decoded UPCA product code as a string.
